poem:
NightWatch at HMP Gloucester

In the grip of October's chill,  
a Skoda hums its hymn—  
moonbeams linger,  
ghosts float in echo.

Daisy, Charlie,   
with laughter's embrace,  
weave shadows into light.

Synth whispers chase the past,  
our haunted hearts fumble  
across forgotten bars,  
finding warmth  
in spectral grace.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
